Everyone has the right to the knee jerk reaction of being scared about the stability(or lack there of) of having Bradford under center. But here are a couple things to make you feel better:

1. Our reconditioning program for injured players is maybe the best in the league. just like players and coaches, doctors and staff are not all equal. See Peters and Maclin and how they lit up the league after coming back from torn ligaments. This should help us understand why Kelly isn't afraid of injury as much as the common fan.

2. Mark Sanchez outplayed nick foles last year. Not by much, but he certainly did. Sure he was the qb when we were eliminated. He's also the qb that had to play Seattle, green bay and dallas twice. That's  4 games against the 3 best teams in the conference. The skins game is on him. But focus less on the w/l record and more on the fact that we have a guy who can win games when called upon as a back up. How many teams have that? 

3. The offense has been almost completely turned over from day 1 and has finished top 5 both years. Don't expect that to change. And the defense, who was second in sacks and decent against the run, just got a makeover on the back end. Dez toasting us for 3 and john Brown late. Remember? This was almost a 12 win team last year. And they should be as good or better on o and d and our special teams is literally the best in the league.

4. We dont have to play gb or sea.

5. We have the lightest travel schedule in the league.

Every year at the walk that my family and I participate in there are awesome gifts, activities, and raffles. I've won Troy Polamalu's signature and a tattoo to put in prospective how cool the gifts are. This year there will be no eagle support 
Because of the paperwork we sent the Eagles to fill out, was from Pittsburgh... It was just a business paper, this specific paper is always from there. My family and I have supported the Eagles for decades, our family member dies and we put an amazing awareness walk on in her honor, and they disregard everything and step all over our cause because the paper is from Pittsburgh?   This walk takes place like 15 minutes away from philly.... How can the Eagles allow the steelers to do a greater charity than them ...To philly's fans. My family is all about Philadelphia... data.name: Coach Kelly: Mathis Asked To Be Released

data.message: Come on guys we all know Mathis was incredible and very likable during his time in Philly. It would be ridiculous for any true fan to wish him anything but the best of luck wherever he ends up. These things happen.
Chip is doing what he came to do! Get rid of the big headed players and make a GREAT TEAM!

We don't need Players like D.Jackson, McCoy or Mathis now. McCoy has become 12 Million per Year. Chip Kelly trade him for a young Linebacker and Kiko Alonso will be one of the best Linebacker in the NFL. We have save many cap-space. data.name: Trusting Coach Kelly And The O-Line Picture

data.message: So sick of listening to people who watch four games a year and have never taken a snap or managed a roster in their life criticize every decision made. Shut up already.

*mindlessly* trusting Chip Kelly
Fixed it for you
Releasing a big bruiser like Evan Mathis is...surprising...but you have to have faith in the coaching staff and that Coach Kelly knows what he's doing.

You have no depth because you released half the line. How did that work out last year with the injuries and now those back ups are the starters with a QB with bad knees. Not enough spin in th PR world to sell that to intelligent fans.

Stoutland and Kelly both come from the college ranks, where entire rosters turn over after 3-4 years when players graduate.  This is nothing new for them.  It should be good for the Eagles, these coaches are teachers and good at working with roster turnover.  They know what's best for the team, Go Eagles!

You know, kinda like the blunder that Carroll did in the Super Bowl?
